topic.name: Global Imperialism & Industrial Age (1800–1914)
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Global Imperialism & Industrial Age (1800–1914) in History & Social Studies

objectives.objective_text: Identify Germany on a map.
Name a helmet with a spike (Prussian).
Identify the Kaiser (Emperor).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Identify steam trains and big factories.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Name Queen Victoria.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Identify child labor as a problem solved by reformers.
Identify tea and silk from Asia.
Name the British soldiers in India.
Identify Gandhi (later) as a leader for freedom.
Identify Samurai swords.
Name Japan as an island nation.
Identify Japan becoming a strong military power.
Identify that people have different ideas about sharing.
Name 'Freedom' as a big idea.
Identify Karl Marx (wrote a book about workers).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Identify a map of Africa with many colors.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Name explorers who went on safaris.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Identify David Livingstone (Missionary Explorer).
Recall that many small places became one big country.
Observe a map of Europe changing.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Recall that machines began to do work instead of hands.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Observe smoke coming from chimneys in old pictures.
Recall that China had to open its doors.
Observe the flag of Hong Kong.
Recall that they learned to build trains and ships very fast.
Observe pictures of Samurai wearing suits.
Recall that some people wanted kings and some didn't.
Observe flags representing countries (Nationalism).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Recall that people took land that wasn't theirs.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Observe that Africa has many different countries.
Summarize who Otto von Bismarck was (Iron Chancellor).
Explain 'Blood and Iron' (war and industry).
Explain the alliance system set up by Bismarck.
Defend the genius of Bismarck's diplomacy.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how the steam engine changed travel.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Explain what 'The sun never sets on the British Empire' means.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Explain the rise of the working class.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Defend the long-term rise in living standards despite short-term suffering.
Summarize the British rule in India (The Raj).
Explain the Opium Wars (forcing China to buy drugs).
Explain the humiliation of the Qing Dynasty.
Defend the complexity of missionary work amidst imperialism.
Summarize how Commodore Perry opened Japan.
Explain why Japan wanted to be like the West (to stay safe).
Explain the end of the Samurai class.
Defend the strategic necessity of Japan's expansion for resources.
Summarize what a 'Revolution' is.
Explain Nationalism (loving your country/people).
Explain Classic Liberalism (freedom/rights).
Defend the biblical view of private property against collectivism.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Summarize why European countries wanted Africa (Resources).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Berlin Conference (cutting up the cake).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Explain the resistance (e.g., Zulu Wars/Ethiopia).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Defend the sovereignty of Ethiopia (Battle of Adwa).
Compare France and Germany as neighbors who fought.
Analyze the strategy of Realpolitik.
Interpret the Franco-Prussian War's impact on French pride.
Connect the unification of Germany to the balance of power.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Compare life on a farm with life in a factory city.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the shift from agrarian to industrial economy.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the Crystal Palace Exhibition (1851) as a symbol of power.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Connect the navy's strength to trade dominance.
Compare the Boxer Rebellion (fighting back) with Sepoy Mutiny.
Analyze the 'Jewel in the Crown' (India's economic value).
Interpret the 'Spheres of Influence' in China.
Connect the Open Door Policy to US interests.
Compare a Shogun (old leader) with an Emperor (new leader).
Analyze the rapid industrialization of Japan.
Interpret the slogan 'Rich Country, Strong Army'.
Connect the Russo-Japanese War to Japan's rise as a world power.
Compare Capitalism (business) with Socialism (sharing).
Analyze the 'Communist Manifesto'.
Interpret the revolutions of 1848.
Connect Darwinism to 'Social Darwinism' (survival of the fittest in society).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Compare the map of Africa before and after 1885.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the motives: Economic, Political, and Religious.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the concept of 'Artificial Borders' cutting through tribes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Connect rubber production in the Congo to King Leopold's cruelty.
Evaluate the 'Kulturkampf' (culture struggle against the church).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the social cost of industrialization (Dickensian poverty).
Evaluate the Treaty of Nanking (Unequal Treaties).
Evaluate the cultural shift from feudalism to modernism.
Evaluate the utopian promises of Marxism vs. reality.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the long-term infrastructure benefits vs. exploitation.
Construct a profile of the German Empire's constitution.
Synthesize the disruption of European stability caused by a unified Germany.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Construct an economic analysis of the Industrial Revolution's origins in Britain.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Britain’s Industrial Revolution and Global Dominance
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the relationship between coal, iron, and empire.
Construct a history of the East India Company as a corporate state.
Synthesize the rise of Asian nationalism.
Construct a comparison of Chinese and Japanese responses to the West.
Synthesize the seeds of WWII in Japan's rise.
Construct a genealogy of modern political thought.
Synthesize the impact of these ideologies on the 20th century.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Construct a critique of the 'Civilizing Mission' ideology.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Scramble for Africa and Berlin Conference
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the legacy of colonialism in modern African conflicts.
